entry.title: SAP ABAP SDK for IBM watsonx v1.4.0 released
entry.content:
On September 26, 2025, IBM has released version 1.4.0 of its ABAP¬Æ Software Development Kit (SDK) for IBM¬Æ watsonx‚Ñ¢ services. The watsonx.ai service can be used to train, validate, tune, and deploy foundation and machine learning models. The watsonx.ai Runtime is used to build, run and manage generative AI and machine learning applications with built-in performance and scalabilityThe ABAP SDK provides a class library that can be downloaded to SAP systems using abapGit and comes in two flavors:

  • ABAP SDK for IBM watsonx, using SAP NetWeaver for the SAP Business Suite running on SAP NetWeaver 7.50 or above and for the SAP S/4HANA on-premises edition.
  • ABAP SDK for IBM watsonx, using SAP BTP ABAP Environment for the SAP Business Technology Platform ABAP Environment.

Enhancements in this release include new watsonx.ai methods in the groups Prompt Sessions and Prompts. More information about the changes in version 1.4.0 can be found in the repositories in the migration document MIGRATION-V1.4.0.md.

Detailed information on how to setup and use the SDK can be found in the README.md files of the GitHub repositories. The README.md files also provide two comprehensive examples to show how the supported services can be used. An even more elaborated article about how use watsonx services with the ABAP SDK can be found in Joachim Rese's blog article How to Bring Generative AI to Your ABAP Program Using the ABAP SDK for IBM watsonx.

But if you simply grab the correct one from CosmosDB, then the string matches the ".../providers/Microsoft.DocumentDB/databaseAccounts..." format, that the BTP backend expects, and I got no error message anymore ü•≥

entry.title: Re: SAP Build Work Zone Security
entry.content:
Hi @ROHITGERA1,

unfortunately I'm not an export with CIS and Work Zone but I'll give it a try:

1. you can configure SSO with Microsoft Entra without User Provisioning (running CIS in proxy mode) or with user provisioning. In the second case, users are "copied" from Microsoft Entra to CIS (more specifically: Identity Directory Service).
If you need to provision users to Work Zone, you need a user source. So those users have to be available in one source. CIS is a likely candidate in a SAP scenario.

2. I don't know but potentially u could have multiple IPS scenarios setup where u provision users from multiple sources to a central user story like CIS (Identity Directory Service) and from there u provision the users to your target solutions?

3. Seems like the standard edition supports it as well: https://help.sap.com/docs/build-work-zone-standard-edition/sap-build-work-zone-standard-edition/configure-integration-with-identity-provisioning-service

Best, Martin

entry.title: What‚Äôs New in Purchase Requisitions - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508
entry.content:
Hi Friends, let us look at some of the exciting features in purchase requisitions for the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508. 

Renamed Apps in Purchase Requisition

As of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 release, please find the details of renamed apps in purchase requisition:

Predecessor App ‚Äì Previous Name

Predecessor App ‚Äì Current Name

(as of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 release)

Successor App ‚Äì Previous Name

Successor App ‚Äì Current Name

(as of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 release)

Process Purchase Requisitions

Process Purchase Requisitions - Deprecated

Process Purchase Requisitions (V2)

Process Purchase Requisitions

Create Purchase Requisition

Create Purchase Requisition - Deprecated

My Purchase Requisitions - New

My Purchase Requisitions

My Purchase Requisitions

My Purchase Requisitions - Deprecated

My Purchase Requisitions - New

My Purchase Requisitions

 

For more information, please check:

Renamed Apps in Self-Service Requisitioning | SAP Help Portal

Renamed App in Purchase Requisition | SAP Help Portal

Configuration of Message for Service Performer

With this release, you can configure the message for the Service Performer while creating a service item or limit service item for a purchase requisition in the Manage Purchase Requisitions ‚Äì Professional app.

DMS Header Attachments in Purchase Requisitions

With this release, you can now use DMS (Document Management Service), in the Manage Purchase Requisitions ‚Äì Professional and Create Purchase Requisition ‚Äì Advanced apps, when HDM (Harmonized Document Management) is activated.

Requisitioner Name in Process Purchase Requisitions

With this release, you can now view the Requisitioner Name field for a purchase requisition in the Process Purchase Requisitions app.

The Created by User Description and Description fields are removed and now both the Created By and Requested By fields display ID and description.

 

Configuration in Central Procurement

With this release, using the new SSCUI, Activate Central Requisitioning Approval, you can enable approval of a central purchase requisition when any modifications are made in the connected system. Accordingly, a relevant workflow is triggered in the hub system.

 

Extensibility in Central Procurement

With this release:

The service, Purchase Requisition - OData V4 (API_PURCHASEREQUISITION_2), is enhanced by a new distribution indicator, Distribution by Amount = ‚Äú3‚Äù in the item node for the MultipleAcctAssgmtDistribution field.

The service Purchase Requisition - Send Status Update Notifications (PurchaseRequesitionStatusNotification_Out), is enhanced by a new service node, LogMessage.

The business object interface, I_PURCHASEREQUISITIONTP, is enhanced with the following business events enabled for local consumption:

  • CREATED
  • CHANGED
  • APPROVED
  • REJECTED
  • ITEMCREATED
  • ITEMCHANGED
  • ITEMAPPROVED
  • ITEMREJECTED

 

The BAdI, Setting of Default Delivery Address of Self-Service Purchase Requisition (MM_PUR_SSP_DEF_DEL_ADRS_SIMPLE), is enhanced with two new fields Street 2 and Street 3 in the delivery address of a purchase requisition.

The importing parameter of this BAdI has been enhanced with custom fields of a purchase requisition.

Deprecation Details:

The API service API_PURCHASEREQ_PROCESS_SRV is deprecated in a previous release. We recommend you switch to the successor API service API_PURCHASEREQUISITION_2 as soon as possible.

For changes to identity and access management (IAM) objects, please check: Identity and Access Management (IAM): Change Overview | SAP Help Portal

This is a brief overview of the new features available in SAP Ariba Central Procurement for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508. I hope you found this blog post insightful.

Click here for the complete release highlights of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508.

Click here for a recap of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2502 release highlights.

Share your feedback and thoughts in the comments section, and in case you have further questions, please post them on the community page using the link below:

Ask a question

For more information on Purchase Requisition in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, public edition, check out the link: SAP Help Portal Product Page

entry.title: What‚Äôs New in SAP Ariba Central Procurement ‚Äì SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508
entry.content:
This blog post contains the latest capabilities and features in SAP Ariba Central Procurement in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

Central Purchasing

With this release, the fields Contract for Limit and Contract Item Reference are now available in the Process Purchase Requisitions Centrally and Manage Purchase Orders Centrally apps.

Central Purchase Contracts

With this release,

  • You can now edit the Price Unit field values while creating a new line item before releasing the central purchase contract and central purchase contract hierarchy in Manage Central Purchase Contracts app.
  • You can make mass changes for specific fields, which are configured for editability at the header and item levels of distributed purchase outline agreements (purchase contracts and purchase scheduling agreements) in their connected systems, using SAP GUI for HTML applications Mass Changing of Scheduling Agreements (transaction code: MEMASSSA) and Mass Changing of Contracts (transaction code: MEMASSCONTRACT).
  • You can now change the Central Purchasing Organization and Supplier details while copying and creating a new central purchase contract from an existing central purchase contract in the Manage Central Purchase Contracts app.
  • You can now view and compare modified values of central purchase contract fields to previous values when version management is enabled using the button Change Log in the Manage Central Purchase Contracts app.
  • You can now use the new field MRP Sourcing Control, to manage the source list details, while creating and editing a central purchase contract or central purchase contract hierarchy after it is released in the Manage Central Purchase Contracts app.
  • You can now modify the Purchasing Group field value even after distribution, which is available in the Distributed Outline Agreement Information in the Distributed Outline Agreement section of a central purchase contract in the Manage Central Purchase Contracts app.
  • While creating a central purchase contract, you can now enable single line distribution in the Manage Central Purchase Contracts and Mass Changes to Central Purchase Contracts apps.
  • When a central purchase contract is changed, a new column Text ID is available for the print relevant fields and is accordingly available on the output in the relevant language when a central purchase contract is released. The language of this Text ID in the output is the same as the supplier language.
  •  The Header Text is available in the Notes section of a central purchase contract and central purchase contract hierarchy in the Manage Central Purchase Contracts app.

 

Configuration in Central Procurement

With this release, using the new SSCUI, Maintain Conditions to Restart Workflows for Centrally Managed PRs, you can maintain the conditions to re-trigger the workflow for centrally managed purchase requisitions in the hub system.

 

Extensibility in Central Procurement

With this release:

  • The service, Central Purchase Contract (API_CENTRAL_PURCHASECONTRACT) is enhanced with a new field PurchasingGroup under Distributed Payment Terms.
  • The BAdI, Check of Central Purchase Contract Before Saving (MM_PUR_S4_CCTR_CHECK) now supports warning messages.

This is a brief overview of the new features available in SAP Ariba Central Procurement for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508. I hope you found this blog post insightful.

Click here for the complete release highlights of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508.

Click here for a recap of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2502 release highlights.

Share your feedback and thoughts in the comments section, and in case you have further questions, please post them on the community page using the link below:

Ask a question

For more information on SAP Ariba Central Procurement in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, public edition, check out the link: SAP Help Portal Product Page

entry.title: Understanding the importance of legacy bonus plan eligibility rules in Variable Pay
entry.content:
Introdution

In this blog we look at the importance of legacy bonus plan eligibility rules in Variable Pay. We can turn them on with the following checkboxes:

 

They are the only ones that will work both for EC records and Imported (non-EC) records (EC bonus plan rules only work for EC imported records) and as such are critical to handle the following scenarios:

  • Case of permanently transferred employees (for example 1/1 to 3/31 employee of the Peru legal entity then 4/1 to 9/1 employee of the Canada legal entity and since 9/2 employee of the US legal entity) where customer needs to export the data for the different userID retrieved from EC and load it under the ID of the latest active record in order for the full payout to show up on the statement of the most current active record of the employee.
  • Case of EC data missing for the first cycle (for example bonus cycle is 1/1 to 12/31 and EC data cutover was 9/1 so two third of the fiscal year data of reference is missing in EC and needs to be imported in the VarPay template's Employee History.

What is supported and not supported in legacy rules based on the few information I was able to gather and most importantly based on my own testing in my demo environment:

  • SUPPORTED : OR conditions
  • NOT SUPPORTED : OR + AND conditions
  • NOT SUPPORTED : > or < conditions on decimal fields

 

How to handle simple OR conditions in legacy bonus plan rules

 

 

How to handle more complex cases ? 

Turn on the following setting in Plan Setup :

Then navigate to Configure Business Rules and chose the following:

 

Save the rule (you might need to navigate to Manage Business Configuration > Employee Profile > Background Element > click Details on the field you want to use to know their unique ID such as ffld2 or vfld4)  then map it to your Bonus Plan :

 

 

 

 

 

All the best,
Xavier

 

 

--


If you found this blog useful please consider giving it a kudo !

entry.title: Use BTP destination service to call SAC multi-actions API
entry.content:
Based on the standard product document, this blog shows practical implementation steps to call SAC multi actions API from a BTP destination service that can be used in BTP CAPM service.

https://help.sap.com/docs/connectivity/sap-btp-connectivity-cf/user-propagation-via-saml-2-0-bearer-assertion-flow

 


1. In SAC System/Administration/App Integration, create an oAuth client with API Access and SAML2.0 Grant. Note down the Client ID and Secret. Some blogs say using Interactive Usage for the purpose, but the testing shows no return of SAC auth token.

 

 

2.  Note down oAuth2SAML Token URLs

 

3. Note down your SAC multi-action URL

 

4. In BTP Cockpit, create a BTP destination service that has a destination pointing to SAC oAuth Client and create a service key with a pair of client id and client credential. The service key is only used for Postman testing, but it‚Äôs unnecessary for the bound BTP app.

 

 

5. Download BTP signing certificate and IDP metadata from BTP destinations at sub account level. Kindly note that a destination service is created in dev space and bound with an BTP application.

 

 

6. In SAC, create a trusted identify provider maintained accordingly. The provider name should come from Entity ID of the downloaded IDP metadata and the signing certificate should come the downloaded trust from BTP destinations.

 

 

 

7. Add the userIdSource property to the BTP destination to allow passing the BTP access token attribute to SAC auth token.

 

 

 

8. Get a BTP access token using password credentials grant type.

 

 

 

9. Verify the BTP access token if it contains the email attribute.

 

 

 

 

10. Use the BTP access token to call BTP destination service to get a SAC auth token.

 

 

 

11. Use the SAC auth token to get a SAC CSRF token.

 

12. Use both the SAC auth token and SAC CSRF token to execute SAC multi-action.

13. Use the SAC auth token to get SAC multi-action execution status and verify it was successful.

14. How to allow BTP CAPM to use the destination service to call the SAC multi-action.

a. Update the package.json to have a reference to the BTP destination in the destination service that has been bound with the BTP app.

 

  "cds": {

    "requires": {

      "uaa": {

        "kind": "xsuaa"

      },

      "db": {

        "kind": "hana"

      },

      "CapExDestinationForUI": {

        "kind": "rest",

        "credentials": {

          "destination": "sac-multi-actions-dest_CLONING"

        },

        "csrf": {

          "method": "get",

 

 

          "url": "https://ps-trial.us10.hcs.cloud.sap/api/v1/csrf"

        }

      }

    }

  }

 

b. In a CAPM service event, connect to the destination and use POST method to call the multi action URL. It by default uses different Content-Type that might cause 415 Error, so pass application/json to overwrite the default to make sure it‚Äôs successful.

 

      let service = await cds.connect.to('CapExDestinationForUI');

      let projects = await service.tx(req).send("POST", "/multiActions/t.16:9C88BE058AA23F014E86756BBDB404D3/executions", req.data, { "Content-Type": "application/json" });

entry.title: Quantifying Process Improvements: Creating Value Cases in SAP Signavio Process Intelligence
entry.content:
Organizations on a transformation journey need to ensure every process improvement delivers measurable business value. But how can you quantify the savings, track progress, and connect improvement ideas to larger transformation strategies?

SAP Signavio streamlines this through Value Cases - a structured approach to value analysis, calculation, and alignment with transformation initiatives from the SAP Signavio Process Transformation Manager. In this blog post, we‚Äôll explore:

  • What a Value Case is
  • How to create and analyze one
  • How to link Value Cases to Initiatives in SAP Signavio Process Transformation Manager

 

What is a Value Case in SAP Signavio Process Intelligence?

A Value Case allows you to systematically quantify how much a process improvement project can save or gain your organization. Think of it as a mini-business case tied directly to a process metric (like cycle time, rework rate, manual steps, etc.).

Value cases in SAP Signavio Process Intelligence use structured value analysis based on proven SAP Value Lifecycle Management (VLM) formulas to ensure accurate business impact quantification. The solution provides direct documentation, allowing all value calculation logic and assumptions to be documented and maintained in a single location for easy reference and auditability. It supports scenario-based calculations, enabling users to adjust assumptions such as standard processing times or average labor rates. Value cases can be integrated and linked to transformation initiatives, which provides are more holistic picture by consolidating the analysis and findings and ensures alignment with broader business objectives.

 

How to Create a Value Case

Prerequisites: You must have the manager or analyst role for the relevant process.

1. Choose Your Starting Point

You can create a value case via:

  • The Value Cases Tab: Manage value cases directly and create new ones from here
  • The Metric Library: Use the metric library which provides you with preconfigured metrics. Some of them are agnostic, others are tailored to specific business processes.

 

  • Your Metric Collection: Choose an existing metric already in use.

 
2. Define the Value Case

Each value case includes:

  • One metric: The key process indicator you want to improve (e.g., invoice processing time).
  • A value formula: Predefined by SAP or customizable.
  • Assumptions and Context: SAP-suggested factors (such as average hourly rates) or tailored organizational numbers.
3. Calculation and Analysis

Potential Value is automatically calculated as:

(Baseline Monetary Impact per Year) ‚Äì (Target Monetary Impact per Year) = Potential Value

  • Baseline: The maximum potential benefit (here the benefits of getting supplier discount on the sum of all early payments).
  • Target: The potential benefit of reducing the amount of early payments without discount by the target rate, or in other words, receiving discounts for the target % of early payments.
  • Annualization Factor: Normalizes the values on a yearly basis for easy comparison.

You can choose to set a absolute or relative improvement target.

Example:

Suppose you have a metric measuring early payments where no discount has been granted by the supplier. Currently over all completed cases the sum of early payments is about 16.99 ‚Ç¨ million.

As mentioned, the metric library already provides plenty of pre-build calculations and definitions of metrics to be used. In this example, the early payments metric is defined as the sum of the amount converted (eur) where the case was cleared more than three days before the due date, no discount was granted, the case is already completed and the system is I2P.

The calculation can be seen in the following:

The metric can now be used as the basis for the value case calculation, by clicking on "Create Value Case" on the bottom right.

Select the value driver, in this example Improve Days Payable Outstanding. You could also pick for instance, reduce finance cost. They are later used to categorize and group multiple value cases together. Once created you can find the value case under the Tab 'Value Cases'

Next you can open the value case by clicking on the blue title "Early payments without discount". Now let's add the calculation logic for the value case and define the time period. Go down to to the calculation area and to keep it simple in this example, you can reference to the metric for early payments using ${metric_result}. Let's assume the discount rate for early payments is 2% so add let's add * 0.02.

Now the Baseline Date Range needs to be defined. It quantifies the initial performance of the metric measurement, along with the associated monetary value. It's the value collected from your system before the process improvement efforts, so you can measure your progress against it. In this case, it is now set to the full year of 2023. Notice it also provides you the option to define the target state either in absolute or percentage values. 

Having defined the calculation, time frame and improvement percentage, the potential value is calculated and displayed in the header bar.

 

Linking a Value Case to a Transformation Initiative

Business success happens when improvement ideas aren‚Äôt siloed, but tied to broader initiatives and linked to quantifiable value. For this you can directly link and add this value case to an initiative for example the Procurement Excellence:

Select the Initiative and press Save.

Now it is easily accessible by the users directly from the SAP Signavio Collaboration Hub.  For instance, there could be 3 value cases tied to this Procurement Excellence initiative,  one linked to improving the procurement FTE Productivity and two regarding Days Payable Outstanding. This ensures that stakeholders can see exactly how a process change impacts larger transformation efforts and enables continuous value tracking as the projects progress making the expected business impact transparent.

 

Conclusion

SAP Signavio Process Intelligence Value Cases enable organizations to measure business value‚Äîensuring process mining and transformation work moves beyond theory to bottom-line results. By linking value cases to Initiatives in the SAP Signavio Process Transformation Manager, you align improvement projects with strategic goals, creating maximum impact and insight across the enterprise.

If you want to learn more about the SAP Signavio Process Transformation Manager and how to achieve a value-driven approach to transformation check out this blog.

entry.title: How to rearrange fields in latest people profile standard cards?

In the Legacy People Profile you could rearrange the layout and order of the fields within the portlet via Configure People Profile (in "Edit Block" part). In the Latest People Profile, a similar (but limited) functionality exists only for custom cards via Configure Latest People Profile (in "Content Configuration" within the custom card).

entry.title: Re: Any API to get all users which would respond positive...
entry.content:
Not an answer to the question, only a test where the performance ratio between the two solutions, standard function module (but not released) versus custom SQL (but not API), is around 300 (6 seconds versus 0.02 second), in my S/4HANA ABAP 7.58 system.

CLASS ltc_get_users_with_given_auth DEFINITION FINAL
  FOR TESTING RISK LEVEL HARMLESS DURATION SHORT.

  PRIVATE SECTION.
    METHODS direct_select            FOR TESTING RAISING cx_static_check.
    METHODS standard_function_module FOR TESTING RAISING cx_static_check.
    METHODS compare_the_two_methods  FOR TESTING RAISING cx_static_check.

    TYPES:
      BEGIN OF ty_authorization_field_value,
        field TYPE ust12-field,
        value TYPE xuval, " ust12-von and ust12-bis
      END OF ty_authorization_field_value.
    TYPES tt_authorization_field_value TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ty_authorization_field_value WITH EMPTY KEY.
    TYPES tt_user                      TYPE SORTED TABLE OF syuname WITH UNIQUE KEY table_line.

    DATA authorization_object       TYPE ust12-objct.
    DATA authorization_field_values TYPE ltc_get_users_with_given_auth=>tt_authorization_field_value.

    METHODS get_users_with_spec_auth       RETURNING VALUE(rt_user) TYPE tt_user.
    METHODS setup.
    METHODS susr_get_users_with_spec_objct RETURNING VALUE(rt_user) TYPE tt_user.
ENDCLASS.


CLASS ltc_get_users_with_given_auth IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD compare_the_two_methods.
    DATA(get_users_with_spec_auth) = get_users_with_spec_auth( ).
    DATA(susr_get_users_with_spec_objct) = susr_get_users_with_spec_objct( ).
    cl_abap_unit_assert=>assert_equals( act = get_users_with_spec_auth
                                        exp = susr_get_users_with_spec_objct ).
  ENDMETHOD.

  METHOD direct_select.
    get_users_with_spec_auth( ).
  ENDMETHOD.

  METHOD get_users_with_spec_auth.
    DATA(where) = |    ust12~objct = '{ authorization_object }'\n|
               && |AND ust12~aktps = 'A'\n|.
    LOOP AT authorization_field_values REFERENCE INTO DATA(authorization_field_value).
      DATA(lv_value) = replace( val  = authorization_field_value->value
                                sub  = |'|
                                with = |''|
                                occ  = 0 ).
      where = where && |AND (       ust12~field = '{ authorization_field_value->field }'\n|
                    && |      AND (    ( ust12~bis <> ' ' AND ust12~von <= '{ lv_value }' AND ust12~bis >= '{ lv_value }' )\n|
                    && |            OR ( ust12~bis  = ' ' AND ust12~von IN ( '{ lv_value }'|
                    && REDUCE string( LET value = CONV string( authorization_field_value->value ) IN
                                      INIT result = VALUE string( )
                                      FOR i = 0 WHILE i <= strlen( authorization_field_value->value )
                                      NEXT result = result && |,'{ replace( val  = substring( val = value
                                                                                              len = i )
                                                                            sub  = |'|
                                                                            with = |''|
                                                                            occ  = 0 ) }*'| )
                    && | ) ) ) )\n|.
    ENDLOOP.

    SELECT DISTINCT ust04~bname
      FROM ust04
           INNER JOIN ust10s
             ON  ust10s~profn = ust04~profile
             AND ust10s~aktps = 'A'
           INNER JOIN ust12
             ON  ust12~objct = ust10s~objct
             AND ust12~auth  = ust10s~auth
             AND ust12~aktps = 'A'
      WHERE (where)
    UNION " Simple UNION to get DISTINCT unioned values (so, not UNION ALL)
    SELECT DISTINCT ust04~bname
      FROM ust04
           INNER JOIN ust10c
             ON  ust10c~profn = ust04~profile
             AND ust10c~aktps = 'A'
           INNER JOIN ust10s
             ON  ust10s~profn = ust10c~subprof
             AND ust10c~aktps = 'A'
           INNER JOIN ust12
             ON  ust12~objct = ust10s~objct
             AND ust12~auth  = ust10s~auth
             AND ust12~aktps = 'A'
      WHERE (where)
    INTO TABLE @RT_user.
  ENDMETHOD.

  METHOD setup.
    authorization_object = 'ZXXXXXXXX'.
    authorization_field_values = VALUE #( ( field = 'KOSTL' value = 'CX31015' ) ).
  ENDMETHOD.

  METHOD standard_function_module.
    susr_get_users_with_spec_objct( ).
  ENDMETHOD.

  METHOD susr_get_users_with_spec_objct.
    DATA lt_users TYPE TABLE OF usref.

    CALL FUNCTION 'SUSR_GET_USERS_WITH_SPEC_OBJCT'
      EXPORTING  object                     = authorization_object
      TABLES     users                      = lt_users
      EXCEPTIONS parameter_error            = 1
                 internal_error             = 2
                 not_authorized_for_profile = 3
                 not_authorized_for_user    = 4
                 OTHERS                     = 5.

    LOOP AT lt_users ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<ls_user>).

      DATA(lv_field_1) = VALUE xufield( authorization_field_values[ 1 ]-field OPTIONAL ).
      DATA(lv_value_1) = VALUE xuval( authorization_field_values[ 1 ]-value OPTIONAL ).
      DATA(lv_field_2) = VALUE xufield( authorization_field_values[ 2 ]-field OPTIONAL ).
      DATA(lv_value_2) = VALUE xuval( authorization_field_values[ 2 ]-value OPTIONAL ).
      DATA(lv_field_3) = VALUE xufield( authorization_field_values[ 3 ]-field OPTIONAL ).
      DATA(lv_value_3) = VALUE xuval( authorization_field_values[ 3 ]-value OPTIONAL ).
      DATA(lv_field_4) = VALUE xufield( authorization_field_values[ 4 ]-field OPTIONAL ).
      DATA(lv_value_4) = VALUE xuval( authorization_field_values[ 4 ]-value OPTIONAL ).
      DATA(lv_field_5) = VALUE xufield( authorization_field_values[ 5 ]-field OPTIONAL ).
      DATA(lv_value_5) = VALUE xuval( authorization_field_values[ 5 ]-value OPTIONAL ).
      DATA(lv_field_6) = VALUE xufield( authorization_field_values[ 6 ]-field OPTIONAL ).
      DATA(lv_value_6) = VALUE xuval( authorization_field_values[ 6 ]-value OPTIONAL ).
      DATA(lv_field_7) = VALUE xufield( authorization_field_values[ 7 ]-field OPTIONAL ).
      DATA(lv_value_7) = VALUE xuval( authorization_field_values[ 7 ]-value OPTIONAL ).
      DATA(lv_field_8) = VALUE xufield( authorization_field_values[ 8 ]-field OPTIONAL ).
      DATA(lv_value_8) = VALUE xuval( authorization_field_values[ 8 ]-value OPTIONAL ).
      DATA(lv_field_9) = VALUE xufield( authorization_field_values[ 9 ]-field OPTIONAL ).
      DATA(lv_value_9) = VALUE xuval( authorization_field_values[ 9 ]-value OPTIONAL ).
      DATA(lv_field_10) = VALUE xufield( authorization_field_values[ 10 ]-field OPTIONAL ).
      DATA(lv_value_10) = VALUE xuval( authorization_field_values[ 10 ]-value OPTIONAL ).

      AUTHORITY-CHECK OBJECT authorization_object FOR USER <ls_user>-user
                      ID lv_field_1 FIELD lv_value_1
                      ID lv_field_2 FIELD lv_value_2
                      ID lv_field_3 FIELD lv_value_3
                      ID lv_field_4 FIELD lv_value_4
                      ID lv_field_5 FIELD lv_value_5
                      ID lv_field_6 FIELD lv_value_6
                      ID lv_field_7 FIELD lv_value_7
                      ID lv_field_8 FIELD lv_value_8
                      ID lv_field_9 FIELD lv_value_9
                      ID lv_field_10 FIELD lv_value_10.
      IF sy-subrc = 0.
        INSERT <ls_user>-user INTO TABLE rt_user.
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.
  ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.

entry.title: Cutover Management with SAP Cloud ALM ‚Äì My Experiences
entry.content:
üö¶Cutover time! Anyone who has ever brought a complex IT project across the finish line knows the feeling: countless tasks, multiple teams involved, everyone trying to tick off "their" to-dos ‚Äì and in the end, you need a cool head to prevent the Go-Live from turning into a chaos.

This is exactly where SAP Cloud ALM comes in ‚Äì your personal üß≠ navigator for the cutover. With Task Management, you no longer have countless Excel lists, email ping-pong, or annoying "Have you got...?" messages. Instead: a central platform where all tasks are neatly planned, assigned, and tracked. üéØ

I was also skeptical at first and had to gain experience first. But Noel Denzler, our experienced SAP Cloud ALM cutover expert, quickly impressed and convinced me. Today, it's clear to me that I will only manage cutovers in an SAP project with SAP Cloud ALM.

üëâWhat makes this whole thing so powerful?

Pure transparency: Everyone can see at a glance what needs to be done and where the problems lie. No more guesswork!
Centralized control: You're the conductor üéº ‚Äì and SAP Cloud ALM ensures your project orchestra stays in time.
Live status: Traffic lights, progress bars, and clear timing ‚Äì so everything stays cool even during the hectic cutover phase. ‚ùÑÔ∏è
Efficiency & security: Instead of gut feeling, there's smart planning and traceability ‚Äì for a drama-free Go-Live.

In short: With SAP Cloud ALM Task Management, your cutover is not only controlled, but almost... playful. üòé‚ú®

Which apps and functions can be used?

  • The Overview app for centralized progress tracking.
  • The Guided Implementation app is optionally available for guided task processing.
  • The Tasks app serves as the core for cutover tasks.
  • The Quality Gates app for synchronization points and as a insurance.

How to get started

Ideally, you should start early in the project with a central cutover list or directly with tasks in SAP Cloud ALM. This allows you to collect all tasks that will be relevant later in the cutover phase at an early stage.

Our cutover management expert, Noel Denzler, starts with Cloud ALM task review meetings for each subproject to collect, complete, and initially sequence all tasks. This allows for a consolidated upload of the tasks to SAP Cloud ALM.

Overview of the Cutover Tasks

It's best to sort the list by start date and time.

Quality Gates as Synchronization Points and Assurance

Quality gates should be incorporated into the cutover process to synchronize tasks that must all be completed by a certain date. This ensures that follow-up activities only begin once the previous activities have been completed.

In addition, the quality gates, with targeted checklist items, serve to review the work completed up to that point and ensure that nothing has been forgotten and that the work has been completed to the required quality.

The Success Factors

  • An ALM expert who is familiar with both SAP Cloud ALM and cutover management
  • Central coordination of all cutover tasks
  • Training to optimally prepare and engage all participants
  • Use the Date and Time field to schedule a precise chronological order and dependencies
  • Give all tasks a meaningful title
  • Assign each task to a unique team and responsible person
  • Use MS Teams or a central communication platform to quickly inform those involved about outstanding tasks or to schedule people for a meeting
  • Regular reviews of the entire cutover task plan
  • Regularly back up the cutover tasks in Excel format‚Äîyou never know

üëâAre you ready to tackle your next cutover with SAP Cloud ALM?

#SAPCloudALM #CloudALM #CutoverManagement #Cutover #Tasks #Tasks #GoLive #ProjectManagement #Governance #ProjectGovernance #Qualit

entry.title: Re: Questions regarding Business Partner Migration via Mi...
entry.content:
Hello @RYOGA_HOSHI 

The previous answer from @Moumita2001  is correct. The error happens when the Customer Account Group is filled in General Data. In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, the account group is derived from the BP Grouping.

Possible solution

Leave the Customer/Supplier Account Group blank in General Data.

Use a standard BP Grouping such as  BP01/BP02

If you must use a custom BP Grouping, ensure it is currently mapped to the desired account group.

  • BP ‚Üí Customer: default account group
  • BP ‚Üí Supplier: default account group

If there is a misalignment, you will see CNV_DMC_SIN 587. Assignment of BP grouping is not possible

Useful SAP Documentation references

  • SAP Help: Migrate Your Data ‚Äì Migration Cockpit (F3473)
  • KBA-2805232 - How to define which Customer or Supplier Account Group(s) are created for a BP Grouping in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

Best regards,

Chuma

entry.title: New Developer forums!
entry.content:
Since the platform migration last year so many of you have asked "Where is ABAP?" and "Where are the questions about ABAP?" - we heard you loud an clear. We are therefore thrilled to finally be able to answer your questions as we are launching new Developer forums today!

 

This will be the new home for our developers and technical audience in the SAP Community, and we are starting with forums on the following topics: 

  • ABAP (classic): Everything general around ABAP, the ABAP platform or classic ABAP development. (including DDIC, ABAP List Viewer (ALV), ABAP SQL, DYNP including PBO and PAI)
  • ABAP Cloud: All ABAP Cloud related topics, including ABAP Core Data Services (CDS), ABAP RESTful Application Programming Model (RAP), and ABAP for cloud development.
  • Artificial Intelligence : AI in general, SAP Business AI, Joule, Joule Agents, Joule for Consultants, Joule for Developers or AI Foundation.
  • SAP CAP: Everything on SAP Cloud Application Programming Model. 
  • Data and Analytics:
    • SAP Business Data Cloud, including Databricks, Datasphere, Analytics Cloud and Business Warehouse.
    • SAP HANA and SAP HANA Cloud.
    • SAP Master Data Governance.
  • Frontend / UI5 / SAP Fiori: All frontend-related topics, including SAPUI5, OpenUI5 and SAP Fiori. 
  • Integration: For all SAP Integration related topics. (not limited to SAP Integration Suite)
  • Tooling, including SAP Build: For all topics related to any SAP development tool, like SAP Build Code and ABAP Development Tools for Eclipse. 

But more than just launching a home for our developer/technical audience, we are also bringing back forums as a content type, including a more compact forum feed, threaded replies and not least a filter that many of you have requested for questions with no answers. We will get into the details of the new forums below üôÇ 

All developer forums consist of a hub with options both for asking questions (forum) and for publishing blog posts: 

To be able to publish content in the forums, you first need to join the group/forum, therefore please make sure you hit the "Join Group" button: 

Joining the forum also automatically triggers a subscription to new content published in the group.
You can check or change your subscriptions and notifications in your account settings here. 

Forums

As mentioned above, we are bringing back forums as a content type. 
This first iteration of the new forum feed does not contain any preview of content, thus making it easier/faster for everyone to scroll down the list to identify the questions they might have an answer to. 
The feed gives you an overview over who asked the question, when it was published, and you can also see who replied to it last (and when), if there are replies. 
We also included a filter that many of you have requested, "No answers", which shows you all questions with no interaction. This is different to "No Solutions", as the no solutions filter will give you an overview over questions with an answer, but where the author has not yet accepted one of the answers as the right solution. 
Questions with a solution can easily be identified in the feed with the green checkmark to the left of the question. The second iteration of the forum feed will make it even easier to quickly identify questions with accepted solutions in the feed. 
We also kept the icons for views, answers/replies and kudos/views in the feed. 

 

Another change with forums, compared to the Q&As, is that we are bringing back threaded replies to questions. For forums there is no difference if it is a comment asking for clarification, or if you know the answer to the question. The correct answer can be found anywhere in the threaded conversation, and the author has the option to accept any answer as the correct solution to the question. 
As you can see in the screenshot below, it is not possible to accept any reply, anywhere in the conversation as the solution: 

 

When a question has an accepted solution, it will behave the same way as the Q&As. The question will have an "Go to solution" marker on top, and the accepted answer will be displayed directly below the question with a green checkmark and a green box to identify as the correct solution:

 

Other than joining the group, no special permissions is needed to ask your question in the forums. Even if you are new to the SAP Community, and come here to find help, you can do so immediately after creating a new account. 
As everywhere else in the Community, please do not answer questions with AI-generated content. If you don't know the answer, please move on to the next question where you know the answer, instead of trying to build a reputation by publishing AI-generated answers that do not add any value, and in many cases also are misleading or false. 

 

Blog posts

Blog posts in the developer forums will not have a separation between SAP employees and external community users. 
Although the forums will not be curated,  we will keep a close eye on what gets published to ensure the quality of the content is according to our guidelines. Blog posts in the SAP Community should be used to share value and your personal knowledge and expertise. 
The permissions to publish blog posts will follow the rank ladder system, so if you are new to community, your blog posts will be subject to moderation review. Community users who already have permissions to publish blog posts in the "Product and Technology" categories, will be able to publish blog posts directly in the new forums, without moderation. 
You can find more information on moderation in the SAP Community in this article in our Welcome Corner group. 

The "Featured Topics" section is curated by the SAP Community team for now, and will focus on highlighting important product updates that should not be missed. 

 

Pilot-phase

The launch today is a pilot, as we want to first see how you all respond before we make a final decision on whether or not forums are here to stay. The pilot will run for 3 months, until the end of the year. 

All forums start empty, with no published content. 
The exception is the three groups which we have moved over from the Interest groups, namely "Artificial Intelligence", "Data and Analytics", and "Integration" - these three groups were moved to the new Developers area with their content. 

We will over the next months continuously improve the user experience in the forums and forum feeds, and are as always open to feedback and suggestions. 

And one last thing. We have set the "Application Development and Automation" group to read only for now, to encourage everyone to participate here instead. We will decide what to do with the group and its content once this pilot has ended. 

The SAP Developer News posts from the SAP Developer Advocate team will be published here in the meantime. 

Happy foruming everyone! üôÇ 

 

Known bugs

On the main forum page, the button still says "Start a Discussion", this will be changed to "Ask a question" as soon as possible: 

 

In the mobile portrait view of the forum feed, the last filter tab may break to another line in some cases. We are aware of this, and it will be fixed in one of our upcoming releases:

entry.title: Finance Connect: Strategic Transformation, Not Just Applications
entry.content:
Hello, SAP Community!

As finance leaders navigate an era where strategic agility isn't just advantageous (it's essential for survival), one statistic stands out: According to Gartner, 62% of CEOs have selected growth as their top business priority for 2024-2025, marking the highest level since 2014.

This surge in focus on growth presents both unprecedented opportunities and fundamental challenges: How do you transform finance from a reactive reporting function into a strategic growth engine that powers real-time decision-making across the enterprise?

For part 3 of this blog series on SAP Connect 2025, I‚Äôm sharing my list of must-attend sessions at SAP Finance Connect 2025. These sessions offer not just technological solutions but a strategic framework that aligns financial operations with growth imperatives for finance leaders and finance technology professionals.

If this is the first time you're hearing about SAP Connect 2025, read this blog first.

 

Flourishing Finance Function

Your organization has ambitious growth targets. Your CEO is pushing for expansion into new markets, product innovation, and operational scaling, adding responsibilities beyond finance to the office of CFO. Yet, when it comes to providing the financial processes and insights needed to fuel these initiatives, your finance team is still wrestling with:

  • Fragmented financial data scattered across multiple systems and departments
  • Manual reconciliation processes that delay critical decision-making
  • Disconnected planning cycles that can't adapt quickly to market changes
  • Limited visibility into real-time performance across business units

The path begins with understanding how connected finance can specifically support your organization's growth priorities.

The need to create a connected financial ecosystem that integrates, extends, and automates your finance solutions and processes can be met with SAP Business Technology Platform. SAP BTP will strengthen your existing (and sometimes reactive) finance processes, transforming them into a proactive strategy that enables your finance function to flourish. Check out sap.com/btp-for-finance page for more in-depth information on how SAP BTP helps deliver better and more efficient Finance processes.

Here are my three must-attend sessions at Finance Connect that will expand how you think about finance technology possibilities:

 

Your must-attend sessions at Finance Connect

Scenario 1: Finance Closing

Your challenge: The Finance function needs to take the driver‚Äôs seat in leading the organization to be proactive in responding to changing requirements and strategies. But when it comes to financial close, it‚Äôs still a chaotic and manual process with many versions of documents and reviews.  Read about the full use case here.

The Solution: Explore Process Automation with SAP Build to streamline repeated processes. Eliminating manual tasks frees up your employees‚Äô time, allowing them to focus on strategy and other important activities.

Business Impact: By automating and streamlining repetitive financial closing processes such as data entry and data collection, invoices can be processed 50% faster, with a 55% faster month-end close time.

If this is you, be sure to add this session to your agenda:

A fast close with SAP Advanced Financial Closing and SAP BTP | FIN1909

Wednesday Oct 8 | 11:15 AM ‚Äì 12:00 PM PDT

 

Scenario 2: Enterprise Performance Management

Your challenge: Your team hopes to drive coordinated business transformation through enterprise performance management. But with multiple ERP and EPM applications, the execution of holistic performance management still struggles with fragmented systems that prevent effective forecasting and strategic alignment across the enterprise.

The Solution: Enterprise performance management technology should integrate easily with existing systems like financial consolidation and group reporting. Discover how SAP Integration Suite connects enterprise systems to streamline data availability, while SAP Build automates processes, enabling AI to deliver more accurate predictions.

Business Impact: In their session FIN2330, PwC shares how they were able to shorten close cycles and improve data accuracy in enterprise performance management.

If this is you, be sure to add these sessions to your agenda:

The EPM evolution: SAP EPM across the value chain | FIN2152

Tuesday Oct 7 | 11:00 AM ‚Äì 11:20 AM PDT

Driving Financial Agility ‚Äî PwC‚Äôs In-House EPM Transformation with Group Reporting | FIN2330

Tuesday Oct 7 | 3:15 PM ‚Äì 4:00 PM PDT

 

 

Register Now: Start Your Strategic Finance Growth Journey

The goal is to create an intelligent financial nervous system that connects every aspect of your financial operations to drive outcomes. With SAP Business Technology Platform, your finance team can transform how your organization thinks, plans, and executes on growth opportunities.

Register now for Finance Connect 2025 to gain invaluable knowledge, discover SAP Business Technology Platform‚Äôs finance use cases, and join a community of organizations turning growth ambitions into a connected reality. Take the first steps to transform your financial operations into a strategic transformation advantage.

 

Check out the following blogs for other SAP Connect events:

  • SAP Connect 2025: The Ultimate Business Transformation Experience
  • SAP BTP for HR at SAP Connect and Success Connect 2025 summary
  • Success Connect: Your People Deserve More Than Just Software - They Deserve Success
  • Discover SAP Business Technology Platform at SAP Connect and Spend Connect 2025

entry.title: The capacity required of production order decreases to 0 hour when we start production (receive tran
entry.content:
Hello,


When we start producing a production order and transactions have started (confirmation, good receipt), the required capacity drops to 0.000 hours. This can be seen in the planning tools we use like Capacity Scheduling Table or Manage Work Center Capacity

So, let's take an example. I'm creating a production order that should take 22 hours to produce. I have to start it at 1:00 a.m. and finish it at 11:00 p.m.

Before producing it, I clearly see the required capacity of 22 hours in my various tools. But as soon as I start producing, i.e., making transactions, the required capacity goes from 22 hours to 0.000 hours.

How can I ensure that this required capacity decreases according to the confirmed quantities?

Thank you

entry.title: Re: CDS Views - exclude records where a STRING / LOB / CL...
entry.content:
Hi

5 years later, but maybe this will help someone.

Use the CDS table function. Read through the ABAP method of the table function your CDS with string variable. In ABAP, you can use length for the abap.string type.

Like this

Return Select * from YOUR_CDS where length(YOUR_STRING) = 0;

or if you want to see the length in your data add extra column to your table function and in ABAP:

Return Select *, length(YOUR_STRING)  as YOUR_EXTRA_COLUMN from YOUR_CDS;

and then read the data from table function in new CDS.

entry.title: How to rewrite this ABAP SQL join via the CDS associations and SQL Path Expression?
entry.content:
Hello,

Here's my current ABAP SQL join:

SELECT
  FROM I_PrelimBillingDocumentItem
       INNER JOIN I_SalesDocument
         ON i_salesdocument~SalesDocument = i_prelimbillingdocumentitem~SalesDocument
       INNER JOIN I_PurchaseOrderItem
         ON i_purchaseorderitem~PurchaseOrder = i_salesdocument~PurchaseOrderByCustomer
  FIELDS i_prelimbillingdocumentitem~PrelimBillingDocument,
         i_prelimbillingdocumentitem~PrelimBillingDocumentItem,
         i_prelimbillingdocumentitem~SalesDocument,
         i_salesdocument~PurchaseOrderByCustomer,
         i_purchaseorderitem~CostCenter
  WHERE i_prelimbillingdocumentitem~PrelimBillingDocument  = 'PBD0000061'
    AND i_purchaseorderitem~CostCenter                    <> ' '
  INTO TABLE (lt_billing_doc_to_cost_center).

I think it can be simplified by using SQL Path Expression. The below code doesn't compile but you get the idea what I want to achieve:

SELECT
  FROM I_PrelimBillingDocumentItem[ PrelimBillingDocument = 'PBD0000061' ]
       \_salesdocument
       \_zzpurchaseorderitem[ MANY TO EXACT ONE ] AS sql_path_expression
  FIELDS DISTINCT costcenter
  WHERE costcenter <> ' '
  INTO TABLE (lt_billing_doc_to_cost_center).

It doesn't compile because I_PrelimBillingDocumentItem is not a parameterized view.

How can I define the filter on PrelimBillingDocument = 'PBD0000061'?

Thank you.

Sandra

My system: S/4HANA On Premises, ABAP 7.58.
